message_1:
Let X be a projective and smooth variety over a field K of dimension 2 with a very ample line bundle L. Consider the derived category D(X) of coherent sheaves on X. 

Prove that for any integer n > 0, there are only finitely many isomorphism classes of coherent sheaves on X with Chern character ch(E)=(n,nL, nL^2/2) in the K-theory of X.
message_2:
To prove that there are only finitely many isomorphism classes of coherent sheaves on X with Chern character ch(E) = (n, nL, nL^2/2), we will use the boundedness of the moduli space of semistable sheaves with fixed Chern character.

Let M_X(n, nL, nL^2/2) denote the moduli space of S-equivalence classes of semistable sheaves E on X with ch(E) = (n, nL, nL^2/2). By the work of Maruyama, Gieseker, and others, we know that M_X(n, nL, nL^2/2) is a projective scheme over K. In particular, it is a Noetherian scheme, which implies that it has only finitely many closed points.

Now, let E be a coherent sheaf on X with ch(E) = (n, nL, nL^2/2). By the Bogomolov inequality, we know that E is semistable. Thus, E corresponds to a closed point in M_X(n, nL, nL^2/2). Since there are only finitely many closed points in M_X(n, nL, nL^2/2), there can be only finitely many isomorphism classes of coherent sheaves on X with the given Chern character.

Hence, for any integer n > 0, there are only finitely many isomorphism classes of coherent sheaves on X with Chern character ch(E) = (n, nL, nL^2/2) in the K-theory of X.
